content: Admiration by the Groom
Prince’s daughter!
The curves of your hips are like jewels,
The work of the hands of an artist.
Your navel is  a round goblet
never lacks mixed wine;
Your belly is  a heap of wheat,
Surrounded with lilies.
Your two breasts are like two fawns,
Twins of a gazelle.
Your neck is like a tower of ivory,
Your eyes  pools in Heshbon
By the gate of Bath-rabbim;
Your nose is like the tower of Lebanon,
Which looks toward Damascus.
Your head crowns you like Carmel,
And the flowing hair of your head is like purple threads;
king is captivated by  tresses.
How beautiful and how delightful you are,
love, with  your delights!
Your stature is like a palm tree,
And your breasts are  clusters.
I said, ‘I will climb the palm tree,
I will grasp its fruit stalks.’
Oh, may your breasts be like clusters of the vine,
And the fragrance of your breath like apples,
And your mouth like the best wine!”
The Bride
“It goes  smoothly for my beloved,
Flowing gently  the lips of those who are asleep.
The Union of Love
“I am my beloved’s,
And his desire is for me.
Come, my beloved, let’s go out to the country,
Let’s spend the night in the villages.
Let’s rise early  to the vineyards;
Let’s see whether the vine has grown
buds have opened,
the pomegranates have bloomed.
There I will give you my love.
The mandrakes have given forth fragrance;
And over our doors are all delicious ,
New as well as old,
I have saved for you, my beloved.
